simulation¶

class simulation.Simulation(dataset, AgentCl, learner, cost_distribution, split=[0.5], collect_incentive_data=False, no_neighbors=60, cost_distribution_dep=None, max_it=130)¶

Class glueing all the pieces together. Performs whole simulation.

Parameters

  • dataset – Dataset which extends mutabledataset.SimMixin

  • AgentCl – Class defining agent behavior, namely benefit and cost.

  • learner – Class defining learner behavior, namely fit and predict.

  • split – Defines portion used for fitting the learner. Rest is used for determining eps value, regarding the epsilon equilibrium. Simulation is done on the whole dataset.

  • cost_distribution – Passed on to AgentTransformer.

  • cost_distribution_dep – Passed on to AgentTransformer.

  • no_neighbors – Passed on to AgentTransformer.

  • max_it – Passed on to AgentTransformer.

  • collect_incentive_data – Passed on to AgentTransformer.

_simulate(scale)¶

Private entrypoint to perform a single simulation

Parameters

scale – Perform scaling on dataset features

Returns

Modified dataset including new ground truth labels

Return type

simulation.SimulationResult

no_classes(dataset)¶
Parameters

dataset – Some AIF360 dataset

Returns

Number of distinct labels (classes)

start_simulation(runs=1, scale=True)¶
Parameters

  • runs – Run simulation multiple times with the same parameters

  • scale – Perform scaling on dataset features.

Returns

Modified dataset including new ground truth labels

Return type

simulation.SimulationResultSet

class simulation.SimulationResult¶

Collection of simulation.SimulationResult

Attr df

Dataframe with features pre-simulation

Attr df_new

Dataframe with features post-simulation

Attr incentives

List with gradient ascend debugging information.

Attr eps

Eps value regarding the epsilon-approximate-equilibrium.

Attr acc_h

Accuracy of learners initial h

Attr acc_h_post

Accuracy of learners initial h, calculated on post-simulation dataset

Attr acc_h_star_post

Accuracy of h_star, meaning classifier fitted on modified dataset

class simulation.SimulationResultSet(results, runs=0)¶

Collection of simulation.SimulationResult

Parameters

  • results – List of simulation.SimulationResult

  • runs – Number of runs. Should equal length of results.

_average_vals()¶

Calculates mean and std of some simulation.SimulationResult attributes. Is called in constructor.

_pr(group, time='post', ft_name='credit_h')¶

Calculates selection rate for one group.

Parameters

  • group – Dictionary containing selection criterias for group.

  • time – Either post(-simulation) or pre(-simulation).

  • ft_name – One of credit_h (predicted label), credit_h_pr (score) or credit (true label)

Returns

List containing selection rates.

feature_average(feature, selection_criteria={})¶

Calculates feature average over multiple runs for pre- and post-simulation.

Parameters

  • selection_criteria – Dict to select instances. Empty selects all.

  • feature – Feature of interest.

Returns

pre_mean, pre_std, post_mean, post_std

feature_table(selection_criteria=[])¶

Returns dataframe showing how the simulation changed the feature average

Parameters

selection_criteria – List of dictionaries with selection criterias. Useful for comparison between groups.

Returns

Feature table

Return type

pd.DataFrame

stat_parity_diff(unpriv, priv, time='post')¶

Calculates statistical parity difference.

Parameters

  • unpriv – Dict to select unprivileged instances.

  • priv – Dict to select privileged instances.

  • time – Either post(-simulation) or pre(-simulation).

Returns

Statistical parity difference.

tpr(selection_criteria={}, truth_ft='y', pred_ft='credit_h', time='post')¶

Calculates TPR.

Parameters

  • selection_criteria – Dict to select instances. Empty selects all.

  • truth_ft – Feature containing true labels.

  • pred_ft – Feature containing predicted labels.

  • time – Either post(-simulation) or pre(-simulation).

Returns

TPR

fair-sim
